conclusion: Determine the magnitude of the Ampere force acting on the current-carrying wire.
The wire is folded into a right-angle shape with sides ac = L and cd = 2L. The total length of the wire is 3L.
The effective length in the magnetic field is the hypotenuse of a right triangle with legs L and 2L.
Using the Pythagorean theorem, the effective length is L√5.
The magnetic force on a current-carrying wire in a magnetic field is given by F = B · I · L_effective.
Substituting the values, F = B · I · L√5.
The magnitude of the Ampere force acting on the current-carrying wire is BIL√5.
